postText: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the program. Be clever from the start.
Programming on paper is best. The computer part is easy.
Create instead of defining yourself by tastes. It broadens you.
I'm good at programming because I have great habits.
Software development is easy when everything is frozen.
The worst lesson is learning your first programming language.
A program's true value is whether it meets its user's needs.
Complete projects today, perfect them tomorrow. Ship it!
Optimizing everything leads to constant dissatisfaction.
It's an undocumented feature, not a bug.
